attributes.action: Introduce a rule to prevent the trading of insults and irrelevant remarks at PMQ
attributes.background: The Prime Minister as an elected public official and head of the UK government, responsible for the policy and decisions of the government should not be using PMQ as an opportunity to trade insults and to make irrelevant remarks that do not relate to questions posed.
attributes.additional_details: In recent months responses, quality of debate and the PM's behaviour at PMQ has reached a level that is now unacceptable, as it condones behaviour that would not be accepted in other spheres of society or workplace. The House of Parliament is a working environment, in which MPs of all parties are paid by UK tax payers to govern and formulate policies to benefit society, therefore it is right and proper that questions asked at PMQ are answered in a respectful manner.

attributes.action: Change the law to make cyber-bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background:
This petition is change the law, to make cyber-bullying a criminal offence, with specific minimum punishments for those convicted.
With social media becoming the main portal for people to share their lives with others, cyber bullying is on the increase.
attributes.additional_details: Cyber bullies must face harsher punishments. With self harming and suicide on the rise, social media truly does play a part with it being noted that all teenagers who socialise online will come across cyber bullying at least once. However, it is not just teenagers who are subjected to this online torture, with the internet becoming the new venue to host the modern day witch hunt. It is time that cyber bullies were held accountable and suitably sentenced for their actions.

attributes.action: lower the minimum working age to 12 years old
attributes.background: at the moment the minimum working age is 14 and we think that it should be lower as it gives younger children real life experience and it gives the children a chance to earn money.

attributes.action: Lower the voting age to 14
attributes.background: Lower the voting age to 14 so that this give a better chance for the young to have a go

attributes.action: Increase fines and add 3 penalty points for illegally parking in disabled spaces
attributes.background: Abuse of Disabled parking keeps increasing. The disruption and physical pain of having to walk further because a non Blue Badge holder has taken a space, and those who use others badges because they want to get closer and not park further, now has to stop.
attributes.additional_details: Drivers only see the outside of a person, they dont feel the pain, or other effects that the so called invisible illness causes, which is why they were issued with the badge.  Drivers have not learnt the lesson and wont unless radical action is taken.  It it therefore proposed that any car owner without a badge or those who abuse a badge are fined not £60 but £300 and 3 points on the licence. The law is too leanient and has no effect. I ask everyone to support this MP's as well

attributes.action: Independent, more stringent scrutiny of MPs' interests, influences & conflicts
attributes.background: Need independent body with more stringent rules/codes on all historical, current & planned outside interests, potential influences & conflicts of interests, & their full declaration, so our elected/non-elected representatives work to the highest ethical & moral standards that engender public trust.
attributes.additional_details:
The PM & all MPs/candidates should be scrutinised by an independent body using more stringent, clear rules & do the honourable thing accordingly.

1.	Aim is to increase public trust in our democratic process & our politicians.
2.	Need to minimise conflicts of interest/influence that might bias MPs’ opinions, decisions, actions etc. (including investments, corporate/foreign deals, donations, second jobs, consultancies etc.); need full declarations at point of potential impact.
3.	Need transparency based on plain-English declarations of conflicts (not just posting tax returns that can hide all kinds of other investments/financial interests).

attributes.action: Wood burning stoves should require a licence and regulated for nuisance.
attributes.background: Wood stoves create smoke and fumes that are unpleasant and dangerous to health. The government see these devices as cheap energy. Smoke and fumes produce particulates as harmful to health as diesels or secondary cigarette smoke. This fashion accessory is dangerous not romantic.
attributes.additional_details:
Building regulations are in force to ensure construction is safe, the clean air act is there to make the air we breath as safe as possible,  Environmental Health officers are there to prevent nuisance. 
Building control ignore there own rules and do not take notice of wind effect on the way smoke and fumes enter homes, Environmental Health are reluctant to make a nuisance case because the government policy is to support them, the clean air act is ignored. You cannot keep smoke and fumes out of your home and those with a duty of care ignore the risks. Even DEFRA do not know the full risks in there support of wood burning. Once installed of course anything is burnt. They need regulating and licencing.

attributes.action: Please include a 'Return to Sender Address' on your pro-EU Referendum leaflet.
attributes.background: Include a return to sender address
attributes.additional_details: 16 pages of unsolicited mail requires a return to sender address.

attributes.action: Allow news agencies unrestricted filming in the central lobby of Parliament
attributes.background:
Under present rules, only authorised photography is allowed. 

The UK is fortunate to have one of the world’s great public service broadcasters, not a state broadcaster. As such it is the role of government to allow public scrutiny of interactions and protests, even those critical of the state.
attributes.additional_details:
At lunchtime on 23rd March 2016, during Prime Ministers Questions, Black Rod, the official with responsibility for the parliamentary estates and security, ordered reporters not to take or tweet photos of a protest in the Central Lobby of the Palace of Westminster. 

The BBC’s Norman Smith, who has permission to broadcast from the central lobby, was ordered by the authorities to stop filming mid-broadcast.

http://tinyurl.com/BlackRodVideo

The democratic process must not be subject to censorship

attributes.action:
Pay carers fair rate
Currently get £73.10wk for35 hrs of care
That's £2.08ph
attributes.background:
Adult carer's currently get £2.08 per hour for providing up to 35 hours of care a week,
The minimum wage is currently £6.70 for over 21.
Let's improve the quality of life for BOTH cared for and carer's PLEASE.
I hear if you are a member of house of Lords you get £350.00 a day for just turning up.
attributes.additional_details:
I am an Independent disabled man.
I was damaged by accidents during surgery.
I need a fair amount of care at times.

attributes.action: Make childcare costs exempt from Income tax
attributes.background:
We request the Government to make the child care costs exempt from income tax. This will help in two ways
1. Help provide relief to families 
2. Help bring more people especially women into the workforce.
attributes.additional_details:
1. According to an OECD report - The UK has the highest costs of childcare for any country apart from Switzerland - 26.6% of average family incomes, compared to an OECD average of 11.8%.  
2.  While the long term solution would be to bring the childcare costs down, making them tax exempt would atleast provide some relief in the interim.
3. Families are bringing up the future generation, who will work, contribute to pensions, support the elderly and society.

attributes.action: Treat war pensions the same as the state pension, apply a triple lock increase.
attributes.background: The war pension scheme currently rises in line with the consumer price index measure of inflation.  The state old age pension rises by 2.5% or in line with average pay increases.

attributes.action: Training on Mental Health for Ambulance service
attributes.background: It appears the Ambulance staff do not get the relevant training in Mental Health and they are faced with Mental Health patients on a daily basis. This is becoming more common but frontline staff do not have the skills to deal with risky, suicidal patients, why are they not having the training?
attributes.additional_details: As Mental Health is becoming more common as physical health it is agreed by frontline staff and Mental Health staff that they should have adequate training in Mental Health.

attributes.action: Make the selling of electronic devices with pre-installed malware/adware illegal
attributes.background: A lot of low-end tablets and phones come with pre-installed malware and ad-ware that is a big security risk for the user, normally it is also not possible to remove these

attributes.action: Oppose plans  for responsibility all asylum claims being shifted to the EASO
attributes.background: The FT has brought to our attention plans to make the an EU agency (European Asylum Support Office) responsible for all asylum claims within the EU including the UK, this will mean the UK government will lose control over immigration policy for people arriving from OUTSIDE the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
The story was broken by the Financial times on the 7th March and was also featured on Yahoo news:

http://news.yahoo.com/brussels-propose-overhaul-eu-asylum-system-report-001724988.html

Whether you think we should take more or less non EU migrants surely the member states and not the EU should decide it's migration policy not the EU.

I think we should have assurances of the government position on this issue and whether the Prime Minister and leader of the opposition will oppose these changes.

attributes.action: Free fruit should be given to children in schools! To promote healthilyLifestyle
attributes.background: Free fruit should be given out to children in schools to help promote healthier lifestyle to combate vast illness.Like obesity,dieabetes and other chronic illness.This would help take some pressure off the NHS ,improve people general health and well-being and mental health!
attributes.additional_details:
(NCMP) 2014/15, show that 19.1% of children in Year 6 (aged 10-11) were obese and a further 14.2% were overweight. Of children in Reception (aged 4-5), 9.1% were obese and another 12.8% were overweight. This means a third of 10-11 year olds and over a fifth of 4-5 year olds were overweight or obese. 

Estimated of (those costs arising from the impact of obesity on the wider economy such as loss of productivity) over the same time period ranged between £2.6 billion [1] and £15.8 billion.[2]

attributes.action: Make a it criminal offence for a dog to worry livestock, e.g mauling lambs
attributes.background: Dogs mauling lambs is becoming more frequent.  Not only is the devastation they wreak an economic loss to the farmer but it is also a welfare issue because of the distress it causes to the ewes that lose the lambs. They should at least be afforded the same level of protection by law as wild animals

attributes.action: Make people who claim benefits do  voluntary work/work alongside local council
attributes.background: If people who claim benefits are able to work then they should be made to do something for their money. Why should they sit at home and get money when people go out and work hard and long days for their money? Why should they get it just handed to them and get the easy life without working?
attributes.additional_details: There are plenty of employed who go out there and earn a living why cant people on benefits do something for their money? They don't have time to come in and sit there doing nothing. There routine is get up go to work come in have tea go to bed. The employed don't have time to sit and spend time to themselves because they work for what they have.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for medicinal cures that work to be kept from being used
attributes.background: There are cures for several types of cancers and various other diseases, but because the medicine companies gain more money from treatment they are a happy to let people die.
attributes.additional_details: There have been trials for cures of leukemia 99 out of 100 people were cured but because pharmaceutical companies would lose money by giving out cures rather than traditional treatment they haven't released the cure and they won't!!

attributes.action: Stop the proposed closure of wards at Cheadle, Staffordshire, hospital.
attributes.background: The closure of wards will result in local residents having to travel long distances to other hospitals - mainly to the Royal Stoke hospital which is already under extreme pressure from the sheer volume of patients.
attributes.additional_details: Royal Stoke hospital lacks parking for visitors - Cheadle is well provided for parking spaces. It is also well run and well liked by local residents.

attributes.action: Remove the luxury tax on feminine hygiene products once and for all time!
attributes.background: In the UK, flapjacks and crocodile meat are at a 0% VAT rate, yet an essential item for all women is classed under the 'luxury' tax bracket. The so called 'tampon tax' is a ridiculous way of financially victimising women. We the people (signed below) demand an end to this deliberate extortion.

attributes.action: Introduce a job test for all prospective MPs.
attributes.background: It is necessary to complete a test for most jobs, yet currently there is no testing of candidates for membership of parliament. There is a suspicion amongst many of the public that some MPs are "out of touch" or "not fit for purpose". A test would improve public confidence.
attributes.additional_details: As an initial idea for discussion, I propose 100 questions around 10 subjects including history, maths, logic/IQ, economics, general knowledge, culture, the world, and so on. Like most tests, this test would be changed frequently, marking would be anonymous, and scores would not be published. A candidate would only know they had passed or failed, with a pass mark being perhaps 80%. A candidate would be entitled to a second attempt, but only after the current election had ended.

attributes.action: Health Research Tax on all UK Taxpayers - let's finally cure Cancer and the rest
attributes.background:
A new tax used to fund Health Research, a small amount taken every month from all taxpayers and used to fund medical research. Suggested monthly figure for UK tax brackets:

Basic - 40p
Higher - 50p
Additional - £1

Such a small amount per person will generate £100m+ per year (HMRC Stats).
attributes.additional_details:
Based on HMRC Stats for 2016 tax year:

24.7m Basic rate = £9.8m
4.4m Higher rate = £2.2m
0.3m Additional rate = £0.3m
Total = £12.4m p/m

Funds to be given to single disease until cured then move to next (order TBD).

Suggest management board made of unpaid visionaries who are only interested in making the world better (i.e. Musk, Branson, Dyson etc.)

The Ice Bucket Challenge raised £87m for ALS research leading to the discovery of a gene that will allow them to start developing treatments.

attributes.action: Raise benefits for the disabled
attributes.background: We are from NCS and we're supporting Skills for Life, a charity who help people with learning disabilities. Recent changes to our community has caused living with a disability much more difficult as benefits have been cut. Therefore, we would love to help and raise benefits for the disabled.
attributes.additional_details: Despite all the great things charities such as Skills for Life do, they now have to charge their service users to continue they're amazing work. This should not be the case, especially now that it is becoming less affordable due to the cut in benefits.

attributes.action: Acknowledge the loss of our friend Harambe, and issue a statement of regret
attributes.background: Harambe was a proud, benevolent, and majestic creature. Closely related to we humans, we should mourn the passing of this loving being appropriately. His death will not be in vain. He died as he lived, protecting the innocent, and showing us all how to live our own lives. An inspiration.
attributes.additional_details: Harambe was gunned down in cold blood, on May 28th 2016. He was just seventeen years old. Harambe was agitated by the crowd baying for his blood, even as Primatologist Jane Goodall opined that he was trying to protect the poor child involved (http://www.janegoodall.org/wp-content/uploads/2796_001.pdf).

attributes.action: Increase the Carer's Allowance to £80 per week, from £62.10 per week
attributes.background: There are an estimated 6.5 million carers in the UK, meaning that 1 in 10 people have caring duties. Unpaid carers save the UK government £119 billion per year, more than is spent on the NHS. To receive the carers allowance, you must care for 35 hours a week, when many care for 100 hours or more.
attributes.additional_details: Working up to 100 hours, the Carer's Allowance equates to 62p per hour, in contrast to the minimum wage of £7.20 per hour. The burden of caring is great, with 625,000 carers suffering from mental or physical illnesses - around the population of Glasgow. The problem will only get worse with 6,000 people becoming carers every day - these people need help now.

attributes.action: Change law so a learner can ride a 250cc motorcycle once passed car test or CBT.
attributes.background:
Please change the law for learner motorcycle riders.
Please change from 125cc to 250cc for learner riders. 
Many accidents happen due to mopeds having small wheels.
It's pretty easy for the front wheel to slip away on a corner. Bikes with larger wheel don't usually have this problem.
attributes.additional_details:
This would also help the environment as 4stroke engines would be available. These are much cleaner with less pollutants entering the atmosphere.
If publicised right it could mean less cars on the already busy roads.

attributes.action: I'd like Narcissistic Abuse and Covert Bullying to be recognised as an offense
attributes.background: Narcissistic Abuse and Covert Bullying needs to be recognised as a crime. The victim is often left feeling helpless and controlled. Narcissists are sneaky and will attack while hiding behind others (to guard their reputation). Its a form of bullying which includes smear campaigns and 'gaslighting'
attributes.additional_details:
The definition of 'victim' is A person who is tricked or duped or A person who has come to feel helpless and passive in the face of misfortune or ill treatment.

Narcissists trick their victim, getting a thrill from manipulating them and making fools of them. If the victim retaliates, the narcissist will unleash a smear campaign, ruining that persons reputation. Its a form of covert bullying, which leaves lifes and careers in tatters. Narcissistic abuse can happen anywhere and is soul destroying

attributes.action: Review the child maintenance calculations, in order to make them fairer.
attributes.background:
The child maintenance calculations are unfair to the paying parent, due to the method of calculation. I am asking the relevant Secretary of State to review these calculations and to make them fairer to both the paying and receiving parents. 

This should also include a cap in maintenance payable.
attributes.additional_details:
The Child Maintenance Service uses the tax data from HMRC in order to calculate gross income. This also includes any taxable benefits that are not received as cash. They also have a 20% tolerance for any changes in income (up or down).

This can mean that a paying parent can be on an income of £50,000 a year, with a company car and company fuel, and any other benefits such as private health etc, could be seen to have a gross income of £60,000 (even though they pay tax on these benefits). Also, due to the tolerance in place, they will not review income changes (even a reduction in income) if it is less than 20% change.

attributes.action: Cash for gold to check all items for smart water.
attributes.background:
My mum has been burgled twice in 18 months. After the first time she had purchased smart water to mark her possessions. 
Smart water can be purchased to mark jewellery or any other item which Is high in value. This cannot been seen by the naked eye, but under ultraviolet black light.
attributes.additional_details: Smart water is a non hazardous liquid, which leaves a long lasting and unique identifier on any item.

attributes.action: 5 year minimum sentence if you attack a member of the emergency services.
attributes.background:
Police in the UK are assaulted while doing their job, figures suggest that over 5000 injuries occur each year, this needs to stop.
Fireman and ambulance staff also suffer. On average there are 10 attacks on fireman weekly. 40% of ambulance staff have already been assaulted.

attributes.action: Change the law for drink driving limit to zero and an instant ban
attributes.background:
Far to many innocent people are killed every year by drink drivers. 
It's time a stop is put to it by ways of zero tolerance and instant bans being handed out for any who fail a road side breath test.

attributes.action: Abusive pet owners should face harsher punishments.
attributes.background:
There has been a steady rise in animal abuse in the last few years. In 2011 there was a 23.5% rise in convictions and this is rising.
Many people who have committed these are known for committing  other crimes.
attributes.additional_details: Sign our petition if you think abusive pet owners should face harsher punishments.

attributes.action: Hold a voter registration and information day in all schools for 16 year olds.
attributes.background: We are lucky enough to live in a peaceful, democratic country, where each and every citizen has a say in who runs the country. The importance of taking part in democracy and voting cannot be stressed enough, yet information and education on the importance of voting is minimal.
attributes.additional_details: Too often the 18-24 year old demographic has amongst the lowest turnout in elections and referendums. The importance of voting cannot be overstated, yet there is little information on the process and importance of participating in democracy for young adults. Should 16 year olds be able to register to vote in their final year of secondary education they will have two years to learn about our democracy and consider their views, before being eligible to vote at 18.

attributes.action: Justine Greening to bring back GCSE and AS/A2 ICT development.
attributes.background: We urgently need to develop the current GCSE and AS/A2 ICT courses to meet the needs of those students who want to use ICT skills in the workplace. The Computing alternatives do not provide workplace training suitable for the majority of jobs. Digital skills are still needed.

attributes.action: Stop members of terrorist organisations such as ISIS returning to the UK
attributes.background: I think that terrorist members shouldn't be aloud as they are a threat to national security. They've been acting against British laws and they are against British values and it has been reported that thousands of ISIS fighters have been granted permission to come back into the country
attributes.additional_details: If they re-enter the United Kingdom then I think that they should stand trial.

attributes.action: Secure permanent right to reside in the UK for any NHS employee on 23/06/16.
attributes.background: We the undersigned wish that answering 'yes' to the question "Were you working in the NHS on 23/06/16?" means auto-qualification for any future British status.
attributes.additional_details: We cannot risk losing the important foreign peoples that we as a nation have been fortunate enough to bring to the UK and in particular the NHS. Our health would be worse without them and it is imperative that the UK should recognise their importance to our nation by offering them unlimited free passage in to, from and between our country and others.

attributes.action: Make all 'Brexit' discussions open to public scrutiny.
attributes.background:
Transparency within the European Union has been a real concern since its conception, it was also a significant argument in the Brexit 'debate'.

In a democracy the elected are accountable to the electorate and accountability demands transparency.
attributes.additional_details:
The British people have made the decision to leave the EU and they have the right to hear all the negotiations conducted in their name.

We call on David Cameron and all other UK representatives not to enter any negotiations unless they are fully minuted and broadcast live via radio or television.

Furthermore, we call upon our government officials to insist any 'Brexit' negotiations held by our EU partners which exclude UK representatives be fully minuted and broadcast live.

attributes.action: Raise the voting age in the UK to 28
attributes.background: Due to the level of immaturity shown by the majority  of young people today, lack of respect and generation culture, i feel that at 18, youth dont have not enough experience  to make  judgements that could possibly lead to a nations future.
attributes.additional_details: Lack of participation in national referendum, as low as 28%, meaning they either lack the fundamental knowledge or they just cant be bothered.

attributes.action: Require large companies to pay invoices within 30 days of invoice date.
attributes.background: Large companies impose onerous payment periods on small companies. Small companies are unable to resist because of their lack of power. This results in large companies using small companies as another source of funding.
attributes.additional_details: Recently, to add a further level of difficulty, the large companies have created a charge mechanism for invoices paid in a lesser time. It is quite common for large companies to pay smaller companies in periods of 90 - 120  days.

attributes.action: Parliament should vote to decide when we start negotiating to leave the EU
attributes.background: The UK must leave the EU through a well-ordered, timely negotiation. A rushed divorce will damage us both. Article 50.3 of the Lisbon Treaty gives us two years from notification before the Treaties expire. So we should not trigger Article 50 until Parliament votes to say we are ready to negotiate.
attributes.additional_details: The result of the referendum held on 23 June expressed the electorate's wish that the Government negotiate to Leave the EU. The events since make clear that neither the Government nor the Leave campaign have a plan for the UK's negotiation. So Parliament should exercise control over when the negotiation commences. A Parliamentary vote will also make it easier for the European Council to know when the UK has formally notified its intention to withdraw.

attributes.action: Make its so cars don't have to have their number plates on the front.
attributes.background: I don't see it fair that motorbikes are aloud to ride around the uk streets with just a back number plate and no front one, so I think that cars should only have to have a back number plate aswell.

attributes.action: Companies/organisations fined for hate speech in uniform/insignia or on premises
attributes.background: As a deterrant against post-referendum racism and to encourage a wider sense of collective social responsibility, we believe that penalty fines should be served on registered companies and organisations that own the uniform, insignia, premises or property in/with which an act of hate speech occurs.

attributes.action: Call a legally binding Euro referendum, 16+ voting age, 2-week campaign.
attributes.background: The non-binding referendum on UK membership of the EU resulted in a majority for 'Leave'. The consequences are becoming apparent. Since the UK has not yet triggered Clause 50, we should re-run the referendum with slightly changed rules, so that voters can decide based on the evidence at hand.
attributes.additional_details: Both sides' campaigns were unsatisfactory in providing objective information about the consequences of deciding to stay or leave. While voters accept exaggeration and distortion of facts during election campaigns, the consequences are generally short-term and reversible due to the 5-year terms of governments. For the EU referendum, however, the consequences are permanent and irreversible. A number of key 'pledges' have already been disowned by Leave campaigners, and some real-life consequences of Brexit have already become apparent. UK voters should take this information into account, and decide what they want.

attributes.action: Referendum on full access to EU single market before invoking Article 50.
attributes.background: Whilst respecting the EU Referendum result the Leave Campaign failed to definitively address with the electorate the issue of access to the single market. This petition seeks to ensure that full access is negotiated before Article 50 is invoked. If this cannot be achieved a referendum must be held.

attributes.action: Lower the Voting Age to 15 so 15-17 year olds can vote.
attributes.background: I think that people aged 15 and above should have the right to vote in future Referendums and Prime Minister Elections. Young adults are taught in Schools about Politics and the Government so they will have a clear understanding of why and what they are voting for.

attributes.action: Hold a new EU referendum if there is a major shift in public opinion.
attributes.background: The consequences of leave have, until now, been pure speculation.  They are now facts and becoming clear: a fall in the pound, threatened major job losses, the break up of the UK.  Had these consequences been clear before the vote, the public may have voted differently and should confirm the vote.

attributes.action: Make PM & Cabinet legally and personally liable for election promises.
attributes.background: As shown in the recent referendum, it has become too easy for campaign promises to be ditched and forgotten. That implies that victors are elected on platforms that they are not willing to or that are impossible to achieve. PM/Cabinet must therefore be held to account both as institution and person.

attributes.action: Implement a 2nd EU Referendum allowing 14-17 year olds to vote
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon the HM Government to debate and implement a second referendum allowing 14-17 year olds to vote as the results effect everyone not only voters aged 18 and over.

attributes.action: Demand a re-evaluation of the Barnett Formula in the wake of leaving the EU
attributes.background: Due to gross inequality in the funding of the home nations by Westminister thus far, extra help from the EU pot has been essential in order to help some regions of the UK to thrive. Now that we've voted to leave, the Barnett Formula must be re-evaluated and modified to meet the needs of the people.
attributes.additional_details: Devolution: What's the Barnett formula? - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-29477233
